summary: This document is an email chain from April 23, 2021, regarding confusion over the naming of a legal document in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. A New York Times reporter, Ben Weiser, seeks clarification from the recipient about which specific filing is being referenced, noting that Judge Alison Nathan had previously used different numbering in a footnote.

persons.name: Ben Weiser
persons.context: A New York Times reporter who is confused about the naming of a legal document (Reply Brief) in the Ghislaine Maxwell case and is seeking clarification from the recipient.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: A judge who previously referred to what the email sender calls 'Reply Brief 3' as document 'Reply Brief 6' in an earlier footnote, causing confusion.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the legal case, as the email discusses document naming in her case, though she is not directly mentioned by name in the provided text.

keyFacts: There is confusion over the naming of a legal document (Reply Brief) in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, with different numbering used by the parties and the judge.
Judge Alison Nathan had previously referred to 'Reply Brief 3' as 'Reply Brief 6' in a footnote, highlighting inconsistencies in document labeling.
The email is dated April 23, 2021, indicating ongoing legal proceedings and media interest in the Maxwell case at that time.
